resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/103961</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>103961</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770200702</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Blackbody Spectrum</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Körper-Spektrum</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Spectre de Corps noir</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Spectrum Do Blackbody</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Spettro Del Corpo nero</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Blackbody φάσμα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Espectro Del Blackbody</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">How does the blackbody spectrum of the sun compare to visible light? Learn about the blackbody spectrum of the sun, a light bulb, an oven, and the earth. Adjust the temperature to see the wavelength and intensity of the spectrum change. View the color of the peak of the spectral curve.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Science and Technology</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <language>es</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wie vergleicht das Körperspektrum der Sonne mit 
sichtbarem Licht? Erlernen Sie über das Körperspektrum der 
Sonne, der Glühlampe, des Ofens und der Masse. Justieren Sie 
die Temperatur, um die Wellenlänge und die Intensität der 
Spektrumänderung zu sehen. Sehen Sie die Farbe der Spitze der 
spektralen Kurve an.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Comment le spectre de corps noir du soleil 
compare-t-il à la lumière visible ? Renseignez-vous sur le 
spectre de corps noir du soleil, d'une ampoule, d'un four, et de la 
terre. Ajustez la température pour voir la longueur d'onde et 
l'intensité du changement de spectre. Visualisez la couleur de 
la crête de la courbe spectrale.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Como o spectrum do blackbody do sol compara à luz
visível? Aprenda sobre o spectrum do blackbody do sol, de um 
bulbo claro, de um forno, e da terra. Ajuste a temperatura para 
ver o wavelength e a intensidade da mudança do spectrum. Veja a
cor do pico da curva spectral.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Come lo spettro del corpo nero del sole confronta 
a luce visibile? Impari circa lo spettro del corpo nero del 
sole, di una lampadina, di un forno e della terra. Registri la 
temperatura per vedere la lunghezza d'onda e l'intensità del 
cambiamento di spettro. Osservi il colore del picco della curva 
spettrale.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Πώς το blackbody φάσμα του ήλιου συγκρίνει με το 
ορατό φως; Μάθετε για το blackbody φάσμα του ήλιου, ενός
ελαφριού βολβού, ενός φούρνου, και της γης. Ρυθμίστε τη 
θερμοκρασία για να δείτε το μήκος κύματος και την 
ένταση της αλλαγής φάσματος. Εμφανίστε το χρώμα της αιχμής
της φασματικής καμπύλης.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">¿Cómo el espectro del blackbody del sol compara a
la luz visible? Aprenda sobre el espectro del blackbody del sol,
de una bombilla, de un horno, y de la tierra. Ajuste la 
temperatura para ver la longitud de onda y la intensidad del cambio 
del espectro. Opinión el color del pico de la curva espectral.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wissenschaft und Technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La Science et technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciência e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienza e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Επιστήμη και τεχνολογία</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencia y tecnología</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770200702</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>103961</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/blackbody-spectrum</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
